section.section: A person shall obtain a permit from the Commission before the person may construct a private or semipublic water supply or sewer system for the use of at least two buildings or premises in the sanitary district or areas of Prince George's County that are not in the sanitary district.
The person shall pay to the Commission a reasonable permit fee.
The private or semipublic water supply or sewer system shall be installed, maintained, and operated under regulations that the Commission adopts.
The owner or operator of the system shall pay to the Commission a reasonable supervision and inspection fee that the Commission sets.

text.section:
If an owner or operator of a private or semipublic water supply or sewer system fails or refuses to correct, maintain, or operate the system in compliance with the requirements of the Commission, the Commission may:
make the correction or take over the operation of the system for the period necessary; and
collect the costs for the correction or operation from the owner or operator.
